intro: Hieracium durans, commonly known as the everlasting dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, which are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Hieracium durans is known for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh environmental conditions.
